About Us
========

One place where the world's nations can

gather together, discuss common problems

 and find shared solutions.

The United Nations is an international organization founded in 1945. Currently made up of 193 [Member States](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/member-states), the [UN and its work](https://www.un.org/en/our-work) are guided by the purposes and principles contained in its founding [Charter](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter).

The UN has evolved over the years to keep pace with a rapidly changing world.

But one thing has stayed the same: it remains the one place on Earth where all the world’s nations can gather together, discuss common problems, and find shared solutions that benefit all of humanity.

The most impossible job on Earth. So far only 9 people have held the top leadership position in the world’s largest multilateral organization. What does it mean to be [UN Secretary-General](https://www.un.org/sg/en)?

Member

 States
---------------

The UN’s Membership has [grown from the original 51 Member States](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/growth-in-un-membership) in 1945 to the [current 193 Member States](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/member-states).

All UN Member States are members of the [General Assembly](https://www.un.org/en/ga/). States are admitted to membership by a decision of the General Assembly upon the recommendation of the [Security Council](https://www.un.org/securitycouncil/).

> [![Image 2: Photo of António Guterres, UN Secretary-General](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/2019/11/sg.jpg)](https://www.un.org/sg/en)
> Secretary-General
> -----------------
> 
> 
> In the end, it comes down to values [...] We want the world our children inherit to be defined by the values enshrined in the UN Charter: peace, justice, respect, human rights, tolerance and solidarity.
> 
> [António Guterres United Nations Secretary-General](https://www.un.org/sg/en)

The [Secretary-General](https://www.un.org/sg/en) is Chief Administrative Officer of the UN – and is also a symbol of the Organization's ideals and an advocate for all the world's peoples, especially the poor and vulnerable.

The Secretary-General is appointed by the [General Assembly](https://www.un.org/en/ga/) on the recommendation of the [Security Council](https://www.un.org/securitycouncil/) for a 5-year, renewable term.

The current Secretary-General, and the 9 th occupant of the post, is António Guterres of Portugal, who took office on 1 January 2017.

On the 18 th of June, 2021, [Guterres was re-appointed to a second term](https://news.un.org/en/story/2021/06/1094282), pledging as his priority to continue helping the world chart a course out of the [COVID-19](https://www.un.org/en/coronavirus) pandemic.

[Secretary-General's website](https://www.un.org/sg/en)

[Main Bodies](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/main-bodies)
---------------------------------------------------------

[![Image 3: Wide view of the General Assembly Hall at an event in 2016.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/2021/04/ga_2016_wide-view.jpg)](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/main-bodies)
©UN Photo/Cia Pak

The [main bodies](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/main-bodies) of the UN are the [General Assembly](https://www.un.org/en/ga/), the [Security Council](https://www.un.org/securitycouncil/), the [Economic and Social Council](https://www.un.org/ecosoc/en/), the [Trusteeship Council](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/trusteeship-council), the [International Court of Justice](https://www.icj-cij.org/en), and the [UN Secretariat](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/secretariat).

All were established in 1945 when the UN was founded.

**[UN Main Bodies](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/main-bodies)**

[Secretariat](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/secretariat)
---------------------------------------------------------

[![Image 4: A view of the UN Secretariat building with flags of UN Member States flying in the foreground.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/secretariat_1_0.jpg)](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/secretariat)
©UN Photo/Manuel Elías

The[Secretariat](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/secretariat)carries out the day-to-day work of the UN as mandated by the [General Assembly](https://www.un.org/en/ga/) and the Organization's other [main bodies](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/main-bodies).

The[Secretary-General](https://www.un.org/sg/en)is the head of the Secretariat, which has tens of thousands of international UN staff members working at duty stations all over the world.

**[UN Secretariat](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/secretariat)**

[UN System](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-system)
-----------------------------------------------------

[![Image 5: A family picking up food from World Food Programme distribution center in Syria. ](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/2021/09/food-distribution-syria-wfp.jpg)](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-system)
©WFP/Ali Habib

The United Nations is part of the [UN system](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-system), which, in addition to the UN itself, comprises many programmes, funds and specialized agencies, each of which have their own area of work, leadership and budget.

The UN coordinates its work with these separate UN system entities, all of which cooperate with the Organization to help it achieve its goals.

**[UN System](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-system)**

![Image 6: UN Emblem](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/un-emblem.svg)
UN Emblem and Flag
------------------

The UN’s symbol — who designed it? what does it mean?

[More on the UN emblem and flag](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-emblem-and-flag)

UN History
----------

*   [Overview](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/history-of-the-un)
*   [Milestones in UN History](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/history-of-the-un/1941-1950)
Timeline from 1941 to the present

*   [The San Francisco Conference](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/history-of-the-un/san-francisco-conference)
51 countries sign the UN Charter creating a new organization

*   [Preparatory Years: UN Charter History](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/history-of-the-un/preparatory-years)
Events which led to the UN’s creation

*   [Predecessor: The League of Nations](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/history-of-the-un/predecessor)
The League of Nations and the first international organizations

[UN Charter](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter)
-------------------------------------------------------

[![Image 7: UN Charter cover image in blue](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/2021/03/un-charter-blue.jpeg)](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter)
The Charter that our founding 51 Member States signed 75 years ago to create the UN

**[Full text](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter/full-text)

[Individual chapters and more](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter)**

[UDHR](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/universal-declaration-of-human-rights)
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[![Image 8: Universal Declaration of Human Rights - 6 languages edition, cover image](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/2021/03/universal-declaration-of-human-rights-6-lang.jpeg)](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/universal-declaration-of-human-rights)
Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR) — widely recognized as having inspired the adoption of more than 70 human rights treaties

**[Full text](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/universal-declaration-of-human-rights)

[History of, drafters, and more](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/udhr/history-of-the-declaration)**

[The ICJ Statute](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter/statute-of-the-international-court-of-justice)
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[![Image 9: ICJ emblem](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/2021/03/icj-logo.jpeg)](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter/statute-of-the-international-court-of-justice)
Statute of the International Court of Justice (ICJ) — How is the Court constituted? How does it function?

**[Full text](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter/statute-of-the-international-court-of-justice)

[The ICJ is the main judicial organ of the UN](https://www.icj-cij.org/en)**

![Image 10: Nobel Peacee Prize Emblem](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/2021/03/nobel-peace-medal.jpg)

Nobel Peace Prize
-----------------

The UN, UN system entities, and staff have been awarded the Nobel Peace Prize more than ten times.

[The UN's Nobel Peace Prize awards](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/nobel-peace-prize)
